Key Arguments: The legislation is against free speech, which is considered a basic human right.
The bill represents governmental overreach by granting too much power to the ACMA.
There is no distinction made between misinformation and disinformation, which is unfair.
Misinformation is often not malicious and is believed by those spreading it.
The penalties proposed are too extreme and could harm innocent people.
Notable Quotes: This Bill is against free speech, which is a basic human right, and is an example of governmental over-reach.
It makes no distinction between misinformation and disinformation, which is unfair as misinformation is often not malicious in nature.
